department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Vase, Chung, pottery, shape and decoration typical of Han period, six encircling zones have been burnt with a hot instrument.  Of the two zones of figured designs, that around mouth has roughly drawn spirals and the wide zone around shoulder has tiger motifs.  Very heavy grey pottery with painted designs in brown.  Buff earthenware with burnished black.
title: Vase
